alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:00PM MDT until August 21 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Gila affecting Grant County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected soon. * WHERE...Gila River Above Gila. * WHEN...From early Sunday morning to Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Saturday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 09/15/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 800 AM MDT.
